channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: COVID-19 cluster emerges at Melbourne meatworks; AFL hoping for June reboot

item.description: The exact path the disease will take is unclear, but with no vaccine and populations with no immunity to the new virus, it could behave like previous pandemics.
item.title: 'Learn how to live with it': Virus could last 2 years, report predicts

item.dc:creator: Phil Gould
item.description: Nathan Cleary, Josh Addo-Carr and Latrell Mitchell breached the trust of their teammates, their clubs, the fans and the game. They put everyone in harm’s way.
item.title: The game needs you, so stop behaving like selfish, immature boofheads

item.dc:creator: Neil Breen
item.description: All sports will need to change the way they operate in the wake of the coronavirus crisis. But slashing funding to women's sport is not the answer.
item.title: Women's sport may be the solution not the problem in virus recovery

item.dc:creator: Andrew Taylor
item.description: A number of farmers' markets across Sydney reopened this weekend, but shoppers continue to face strict rules over social distancing and public gathering.
item.title: 'It’s still got that community feel': Reopening of farmers' markets signals return to city life

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: Animal welfare authorities are calling for public assistance after the discovery of cat dumped in Ferntree Gully last week in 'horrific' circumstances.
item.title: 'Horrific': public appeal after cat dumped with legs taped, cable tied

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: Ollie Florent was shattered when the coaches who had him primed for what he felt was to be a breakthrough season were cut due to the pandemic.
item.title: 'I felt ill': Young Swan's heartache for laid-off mentors

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Gillon McLachlan reached out on Friday to reassure club captains, before meeting club bosses in a phone hook-up on Saturday.
item.title: AFL boss reaches out to skippers as momentum builds for season start

item.description: A review, completed at the request of the university's president, also found it accepted more than $US9 million from the late disgraced financier.
item.title: Epstein had own office, unlimited access to Harvard after conviction

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: Seven new cases were detected in the state on Friday including three linked to a Melbourne meat factory.
item.title: New COVID cluster at Melbourne meatworks

item.description: Sudan has criminalised female genital mutilation, making it punishable by three years in jail. It is part of a number of measures to prioritise women's rights.
item.title: Female genital mutilation outlawed in 'new era' for women's rights

item.description: Service workplaces with appropriate social distancing should be first cab off the rank as restrictions are lifted.
item.title: Premiers and the PM need to put jobs first and reopen the service sector

item.description: Beneath our layers of difference lie the things we have in common: we love our families, have friends we cherish. We try our hardest in the unpredictable twists and turns of life.
item.title: Faith column: now is a time to whisper tweet nothings

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: The two towns recorded Queensland's coldest temperatures overnight, while gusty winds keep boaties on guard during the Labour Day long weekend.
item.title: Oakey and Kingaroy shiver below zero as wintry winds blow in

item.description: Gallery of illustrations by Sydney Morning Herald artist, Simon Letch.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Simon Letch

item.description: Alan Moir, The Sydney Morning Herald's political cartoonist, sketches the political unreality.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Alan Moir

item.description: Water Police and 40 State Emergency Service volunteers from DFES have on Saturday joined the police search for 66-year-old man Peter Henry Woods.
item.title: Mandurah police hold concerns for welfare of missing 66-year-old man

item.description: The Premier League is expected to resume as soon as June 8 but the season will not be able to proceed on a home-and-away basis.
item.title: Premier League clubs told season will finish in neutral venues

item.description: A look at the follies, foibles and joys of the human race through the eyes of cartoonist Michael Leunig. Buy prints from Michael Leunig at https://www.thestore.com.au/category/artists/michael-leunig. Join us on Facebook at the Michael Leunig Appreciation Page.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Michael Leunig

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.description: The disruption of air traffic has also created a massive backlog of vaccine shipments that could result in outbreaks of preventable diseases.
item.title: WHO to plan gradual restart to air travel

item.description: A selection of his best work.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Davidson

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.description: State media have released photos of the leader opening a factory and appearing well.
item.title: Kim Jong-un appears in public amid health rumours

item.description: As Queenslanders enjoy their new freedoms this weekend, demand for petrol has fuelled a price rise.
item.title: Petrol prices spike as Queenslanders hit the road amid lockdown let-up

item.description: MThe search for a missing 66-year-old Coodanup man will continue today, with Water Police and dozens of volunteers deployed to search the banks of the Serpentine River.
item.title: Urgent search for missing 66-year-old Coodanup man continues along the Serpentine River

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: Trump's tweet came a day after armed demonstrators entered Michigan's parliament to demand an end to the state's stay-at-home order.
item.title: Trump asks Michigan governor to cut deal with 'very good' protesters

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: If we can hunker down and see out the next few days of cold wind and showers, there is some sunshine in store mid-week.
item.title: Victoria's weather: How long will this cold blast last?

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: After a week of confusion, Australian Border Force has finally provided the paperwork for the club to arrive in the country.
item.title: Set for take-off: Warriors officially cleared for Australian flight

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: The future of nearly 30 rough sleepers housed in a Perth five-star hotel remains uncertain, with the state government yet to make a decision on the future of the pilot program.
item.title: Rough sleepers in Perth hotels face uncertain future as WA flattens the curve

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: Opposition Leader Liza Harvey has criticised the government's handling of the scandal-prone City of Perth, accusing it of parachuting in a new chief executive without an OK from elected councillors.
item.title: Harvey accuses government of City of Perth interference as inquiry drags on

item.dc:creator: David Prestipino
item.description: The Prime Minister has hinted professional sport could return soon as the AFL waits on the states easing coronavirus restrictions next Friday.
item.title: WA hub hangs in balance as AFL eyes partner to get 2020 season rolling

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: A balaclava-clad man who kidnapped, hog-tied and bashed an elderly gun shop owner before stealing 100 firearms from a secure vault has been sentenced to seven years' jail.
item.title: Balaclava-clad man who kidnapped, hog-tied gun shop owner jailed over elaborate heist

item.dc:creator: Stephanie Darling
item.description: Squeeze some lemon juice into a bowl of warm water for a no-fuss DIY nail spa.
item.title: A guide to replicating the naked manicure at home

item.description: The most exclusive fashion event of the year has been cancelled but style enthusiasts are still finding ways to pay homage to the legendary gala.
item.title: A 'naked' dress and six shirtless men: Tales from inside the Met Gala

item.description: Sydney living with coronavirus, May 1, 2020
item.title: Sydney living with coronavirus, May 1, 2020

item.description: The Chinese tech giant, which owns stakes in video game companies Riot Games and Supercell, had said earlier this year it would focus more on smart retail and payment platforms in the future.
item.title: China's WeChat owner buys $390 million stake in Australia's Afterpay

item.dc:creator: Pallavi Singhal
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Scott Morrison says COVIDSafe downloads, social distancing must continue before wind-back of COVID-19 restrictions, Australian death toll stands at 93

item.description: US regulators have allowed emergency use of an experimental drug that appears to help some coronavirus patients recover faster.
item.title: FDA allows emergency use of drug remdesivir to treat coronavirus

item.dc:creator: Tatyana Leonov
item.description: Grit is not only working hard at something despite setbacks, but loving what you do. It’s a combination of resilience, ambition and self-control.
item.title: Learning to harness your grit during tough times

item.description: "Canadians need more than thoughts and prayers," Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said as he announced that Canada would ban the use and trade of assault-style weapons immediately.
item.title: Canada bans assault-style weapons after mass shooting

item.description: Brazil's national funeral home association has pleaded for an urgent airlift of coffins to the city of Manaus, as the country emerges as Latin America's coronavirus epicentre.
item.title: Coffins stacked in trenches, morgue chaos as coronavirus surges in Brazil

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: Presumptive Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden has gone on the front foot to forcefully deny an allegation of sexual assault by a former staff member.
item.title: Joe Biden denies ex-staffer Tara Reade’s sexual assault claim

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Adele Ferguson
item.description: Members Equity Bank, which is owned by 26 industry funds, has been plundering without warning customer money linked to home loans.
item.title: 'Despicable ME': The boutique bank raiding accounts linked to home loans

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: Daniel Andrews has been a strong leader in a crisis. Will he trust Victorians to take things from here?
item.title: Welcome to Victoria, the Doomsday State

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: As big business and the federal government dig in on gas, the world is turning against the fuel and evidence is growing that it is as destructive as coal.
item.title: Falling for an old flame: Can Australia really grow through gas?

item.dc:creator: John Silvester
item.description: For Philip Hocking, his adoptive mother's generosity was never enough. He wanted all her money and to get it he enlisted his son, Brent.
item.title: Murder in the family: Phyllis Hocking and the mysterious broken watch

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: Channel Nine has expressed an interest in taking over the NRL's digital assets in return for a new, extended rights deal until 2025.
item.title: Nine targets NRL's digital arm as part of revised broadcast deal

item.dc:creator: Michael Evans
item.description: NSW residents have begun making the first moves back from the coronavirus lockdown in a bid to deal with mental health now and the economic reality to come.
item.title: Small steps towards the big breakout
